channel.title: Someone please summarize basic java
channel.description:
Well, I have been a memeber of these forums for months, only contributing...well.. barely anything, and I feel it's time to do something good, so I wanna learn some java basics. I started reading the tutorials on www.sun.com, but they were way to ambiguous, and didnt focus on what I wanted to know. So, if someone would just tell me some of the basics. Only java I know is some private server editing and stuff.
Downloads I need. Definitions I should know. Common Commands. Kinds of java and how to actually make code.
If someone could, I'd appreciate it greatly.
Thanks -Adam

item.title: Someone please summarize basic java
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:39116”]its like learning sentence structure of another language… such as french in school, except here you’re learning syntax. learn the syntax, then its easy. after that you’ll get familiar with common methods, and all the libraries (theres so many for java).[/quote]Actually, it’s easier to say this.

Syntax = Grammar
Keywords/Classes/etc. = Vocabulary

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please summarize basic java
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Yep, then its ran through a bytecode interpretter (known as java), and into all your little chips and shit

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please summarize basic java
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:3, topic:38144”]System.out.println(String) - prints the text to the display window
jar -xvf - unfips jarfiles/zip files

(Use it on C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\src.zip)

Once you unzip it, read EVERY SINGLE FUCKING THING IN THERE![/quote]

That’s stupid. Yes, it’s informative, but I only do it when I need to know EXACTLY how a class is operating - I recommend you do the same and use javadocs like most sane people.

@pko:
I applaud your efforts at intelligent question-asking, deserves a serious answer

Downloads may be found here. You want ‘JDK 6’ if you don’t already have a recent version of the JDK.

Search for ‘Java tutorial’ or ‘basic Java tutorial’ on Google - the standard first program is a “Hello, World” program. Sun’s tutorial is going to be the most thorough, but there might be others that are better suited to you. I really can’t tell you which one might work best for you because results vary for different people with online tutorials (books too, for that matter). The best thing to do is try a few and post back if you can’t find a good one.

For definitions of terms you don’t recognize, use mindprod’s Java Glossary (clearer language usually) or Sun’s Glossary.

[quote=“pko, post:1, topic:38144”]Common Commands.
Kinds of java and how to actually make code.[/quote]

Those are pretty broad, what do you mean by common commands?
As for how to actually make code, you’ve been doing it if you know private servers - you just write it in a java source file (.java) and run it through the compiler (javac).

Read full topic

item.title: Someone please summarize basic java
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Lol, you don’t have to go around and read through all of the source files… have a look at the Sun javadocs, they helped me out alot when I started: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/

Read full topic
